sources.title: Konga (1961)
sources.description: Konga is a British-American science fiction horror film released in 1961. Directed by John Lemont, it features Michael Gough as Dr. Charles Decker, a botanist who returns from Africa with a baby chimpanzee named Konga.Â  The story follows Dr. Decker, who discovers a serum that can enlarge plants and animals. He uses this serum on Konga, transforming the chimp into a giant ape to eliminate his enemies. As Konga grows, he wreaks havoc in London, leading to a climactic confrontation with the military.

sources.title: Konga - Trailer
sources.description: Original theatrical trailer for the film Konga

metadata.Plot: Dr.Decker comes back from Africa after a year, presumed dead. During that year, he came across a way of growing plants and animals to an enormous size. He brings back a baby chimpanzee to test out his theory. As he has many enemies at home, he decides to use his chimp, 'Konga' to 'get rid of them'. Then Konga grows to gigantic proportions and reaks havoc all over the city of London!!
metadata.Actors: Michael Gough, Margo Johns, Jess Conrad
